column7: General questions can be formed with the particle rav, which goes before the verb
Questions of reason can be formed by putting jores (reason + exist) after rav
For questions of subject and object, see grammar sheet
Questions of manner can be formed by putting anres (river + exist) after rav
Questions of possesion can be formed by putting edres (of+exist) after rav

column4: To show; to display; to speak; to reveal
to make worthless; to make un-useful

to mash; to grind; to crush
To eat; to receive; to listen; to drink

column5: Can be used with demonstratives to say "because of this" etc.

column5: Consists of two pots, the top will with water with a small hole allowing water to flow into the lower pot, the pots are standardized to 10 handfuls (~3/4 cup)
Unit of volume, equivalent to 3/4 cup
That third def is more metaphorical
